title: Nina Simone - 1969 - To Love Somebody (2013 HDTracks 24 96) FLAC
description:
Nina Simone - 1969 - To Love Somebody (2013)
HDTracks 24 bits, 96 KHz

No slouch as a songwriter herself, Nina Simone ably picked a variety of compositional classics from the new rock era for her 1969 LP To Love Somebody. Opening with a beautiful, introspective version of Leonard Cohen's "Suzanne," Simone shows an obvious affinity for social statements with the Byrds' "Turn! Turn! Turn! (To Everything There Is a Season)" and a trio of Dylan standards: "I Shall Be Released," "Just Like Tom Thumb's Blues," plus a dramatic, meditative "The Times They Are A-Changin'." The title track, originally a 1967 hit for the Bee Gees and one year later for the Sweet Inspirations, suffers slightly from a weak, commercial-slanted arrangement, but her lone original, the two-part "Revolution," is a great blend of blues-rock and soul testifying. Among a rut of jazz vocalists making the worst of a bad situation during the late '60s, To Love Somebody is a rare success. (AllMusic)

Track list:
01 - Suzanne
02 - Turn, Turn, Turn (To Everything There Is a Season)
03 - Revolution (Part 1)
04 - Revolution (Part 2)
05 - To Love Somebody
06 - I Shall Be Released
07 - I Can't See Nobody
08 - Just Like Tom Thumb's Blues
09 - The Times They Are a Changin'
